intro: Specklinia tirimbina, commonly known as the Tumbes pineapple. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is native to the coastal regions of Ecuador and Peru. This plant is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, spiky leaves that form a central cup to collect rainwater. The flowers are typically yellow or orange, emerging from the center of the leaf rosette. It is a rare and endangered species, often found in humid, coastal forests.
